705071f-a.text:
Union Cemetery, Brooklyn:
Northwestward across the Fethodist Cemetery on whose site was erected, years later, the Bushwick High School. The fence runs along the west side of Irving Avenue, from Putnam Avenue to Palmetto Street. The entire cemetery grounds, with the exception of the extreme right corner, later became the Bushwick High School and playgrounds.
Eugene L. Armbruster collection. About 1827
705071f-a.folder: Irving Avenue & Putman Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

705072f-b.text:
(1)
400 Irving Ave., between Putman Ave., and Woodbine Street, showing the Bushwick High School, for which ground was broken on June 29, 1911; the corner stone laid March 12, 1912. (It was informally opened and occupied October 2, 1913, and formally on January 23, 1914. This school occupies a part of the site once the Union Cemetery (1850-1897).
Negative reversed.)
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing school and playground from Palmetto Street.
March 1923.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.
